Responds promptly to the telegram and travels to San Quentin to confront Gordon Northcott before his execution, showing decisiveness and willingness to face difficult truths.
Misses the phone cradle when hanging up, indicating a momentary lapse in attention.
Declines the prison guard's offer to stay in the room, indicating self-reliance and politeness.
Politely refuses Gordon's request for a cigarette, maintaining boundaries without hostility.
Politely declines the prison guard's offer to stay in the room, expressing confidence in handling the situation alone.
Engages in conversation with Northcott, asking clarifying questions to understand his statements.

Gently urges Gordon to look at her and engage, demonstrating patience and a calm demeanor despite his agitation.
Shows determination and courage by coming to see Mr. Northcott in person despite the emotional difficulty and uncertainty.
Maintains composure and attempts to engage Mr. Northcott directly, trying to get him to face her and tell the truth.

Cries openly and shows vulnerability after Northcott is taken away.

Directly confronts Northcott, demanding answers about her son's fate despite the tense situation.

Nods good-night to some witnesses, including the Clays, showing polite acknowledgment.
Declines invitation to Oscar party, citing responsibility and work commitments, encourages others to have fun.
Declines social invitation to focus on work, citing responsibility and ability to manage a difficult situation (phone lines blown out) while multitasking (listening to radio).
Firmly repeats refusal to leave work despite repeated knocks, showing determination and prioritization.
Politely declines Ben Harris's invitation but offers a friendly and sincere alternative to meet later.

Expresses pleasure and excitement over the Oscar win, sharing joy openly.
Answers phone warmly and politely, recognizing Mrs. Clay and asking about her well-being.

Shares a warm embrace with Mrs. Clay upon meeting, showing empathy and connection.
Confidently predicts the Oscar winner and expresses satisfaction when proven right.
Responds promptly and appropriately to an urgent phone call, immediately going to the police station.
Engages calmly and supportively with Mrs. Clay upon meeting her, showing emotional intelligence and presence of mind.
Reacts with visible concern and anxiety upon hearing about the boys in captivity, hand flying to her mouth, not daring to breathe.

Expresses hope for other missing boys, showing empathy and concern beyond her own child.
